intro: Heliophila arenaria, commonly known as sand heliopsis, is a flowering plant native to sandy and coastal environments. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbel-like inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun, making it a common sight in dune habitats. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Heliophila arenaria is known for its resilience to harsh environmental conditions, including salt spray and wind.
